name: Spectral Freeze
description: This algorithm is an audio ‘freeze’ effect – it captures sound at a moment in time and sustains it indefinitely. The ‘spectral’ part of the name indicates that it works in the frequency domain – unlike simple loopers or granular effects, which work in the time domain, this algorithm captures the spectrum of a sound (using an FFT) and uses that to resynthesize audio [104] . As well as completely freezing sound, the algorithm can actually play it back at any desired speed (i.e. it does time stretching) and pitch. There are a number (depending on the specification) of different ‘voices’ i.e. you can freeze different moments of audio and play them simultaneously. The algorithm is based on the disting EX algorithm of the same name. There is an in-depth video for [that algorithm here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8HFm0zzLHRM) [105] .

parameters.name: Freeze toggle
parameters.description: Activates a new freeze when the parameter changes from ‘0’ to ‘1'.

parameters.name: Freeze gate
parameters.description: Activates a new freeze when the parameter changes from ‘0’ to ‘1', and releases the freeze when the parameter changes from ‘1’ to ‘0'.

parameters.name: Freeze target
parameters.description: Chooses the voice for the next freeze, or '0' for 'Auto'.

parameters.name: Unfreeze all
parameters.description: When this parameter changes to ‘1’, all active freezes are released.

parameters.name: Movement
parameters.description: Chooses the type of movement. The options are 'Forwards', 'Backwards', 'Alternating', 'Random walk', and 'Random skip'.

parameters.name: Rate
parameters.description: Sets the rate of movement. '0' is stopped; '1000' is normal speed (as recorded). In between, the scale is highly non-linear to give more control at slower speeds.

parameters.name: Depth
parameters.description: Sets the maximum amount of movement.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Offsets the freeze position back in time.

parameters.name: Etherizatio n
parameters.description: Drops out transient elements of the sound.

parameters.name: Live process
parameters.description: When this parameter changes to ‘1’, a new voice is started which uses live audio input instead of actually freezing.

parameters.name: Coarse shift
parameters.description: Sets the coarse pitch shift amount for all voices. Added to the individual voice shifts.

parameters.name: Fine shift
parameters.description: Sets the fine pitch shift amount for all voices. Added to the individual voice shifts.

parameters.name: Output
parameters.description: Sets the output bus for the voice.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.
